revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-11 10:22:25.000000000', 'message': "Bump Django version to Current LTS Version

This patch update Django version to the current LTS version i.e. 3.2
in global-requirements.txt as Django 2.2 is going to end its extended
support by April 2022[1]. horizon and all its plugins already support
Django3.2 version, So let's make this the default version. Also,
I will update the Django version in ``upper-constraints.txt' in a
separate patch because if I update the Django version in
upper-constraints.txt in the same patch requirements check-uc job
starts failing.

[1] https://www.djangoproject.com/download/
Change-Id: I7c22d7cc8092222a91a1da2bd65958bb3a9599eb

Change-Id: I600d36a842ef56dfb01d932df079a32e7f7395e4

commit_message:
Bump Django version to Current LTS Version

This patch update Django version to the current LTS version i.e. 3.2
in global-requirements.txt as Django 2.2 is going to end its extended
support by April 2022[1]. horizon and all its plugins already support
Django 3.2 version, So let's make this the default version. Also,
I will update the Django version in ``upper-constraints.txt' in a
separate patch because if I update the Django version in
upper-constraints.txt in the same patch requirements check-uc job
starts failing.

[1] https://www.djangoproject.com/download/

Change-Id: I600d36a842ef56dfb01d932df079a32e7f7395e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 05:52:02.000000000', 'message': "Avoid poll_interval to be the same as HTTP Keep-Alive timeout

When OpenStack API services are behind Apache2, HTTP Keep-Alive timeout
is 5 seconds out of the box. Polling operations with the same interval
as HTTP Keep-Alive timeout can cause intermittent failures like:

Unable to establish connection to
https://nova.example.com:8774/v2.1/servers/UUID:
('Connection aborted.', RemoteDisconnected('Remote end closed connection
without response',))

Let's avoid the same value by default as Apache2's HTTP Keep-Alive
timeout.

Closes-Bug: #1946912
Change-Id: Ibda414b129a44d38ed3c3a4b5a43fd45e63ec122
"}, {'created': '2021-10-21 14:50:52.000000000', 'message': "Avoid poll_interval to be the same as HTTP Keep-Alive timeout

"}, {'created': '2021-10-22 11:49:24.000000000', 'message': "Avoid poll_interval to be the same as HTTP Keep-Alive timeout

is 5 seconds out of the box. Polling operations with the same interval

without response',))

Closes-Bug: #1946912
Change-Id: Ibda414b129a44d38ed3c3a4b5a43fd45e63ec122
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid poll_interval to be the same as HTTP Keep-Alive timeout

When OpenStack API services are behind Apache2, HTTP Keep-Alive timeout
is 5 seconds out of the box. Polling operations with the same interval
as HTTP Keep-Alive timeout can cause intermittent failures like:

Unable to establish connection to
https://nova.example.com:8774/v2.1/servers/UUID:
('Connection aborted.', RemoteDisconnected('Remote end closed connection
without response',))

Let's avoid the same value by default as Apache2's HTTP Keep-Alive
timeout.

Closes-Bug: #1946912
Change-Id: Ibda414b129a44d38ed3c3a4b5a43fd45e63ec122

commit_message:
Remove migrated operations

The content of the Operations section was recently
migrated to the Admin Guide (Charm Guide) so it can
now be removed from this guide.

Add a temporary (one cycle) breadcrumb in the now-empty
Operations section so regular readers are not left
stranded. I tried to put the visible link in italics
but it is does not seem possible.

Add HTTP redirects as needed.

Change-Id: Iaf14fd71e460e607311a0a3ff2b2b6d3bc781a36

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 03:56:45.000000000', 'message': 'Allow definition of protected iptables chains

When an iptables rule is created on a compute node
not via neutron, if that rule references a chain
maintained by neutron, the rule will get deleted
on the next security group update. The purpose of
this change is to allow administrators to define
a list of chain names to protect, such that neutron
will not delete those chains or the rules within
them. The expectation is that these chains/rules
would then be managed by some other process. One
use case for this is managing a custom chain when
there is routed traffic to a host entering a compute
node not via an openstack router. Since this traffic
would ingress via an interface that neutron is not
aware of, iptables would not match it, and the
traffic would be accepted. Having a defined set of
protected iptables chains helps to mitigate this
potential security vulnerability.

Change-Id: I2addb7c9239e273d52e89c9bdd61e95354f813f5
'}, {'created': '2021-10-20 13:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'Allow definition of protected iptables chains

not via neutron, if that rule references a chain
maintained by neutron, the rule will get deleted
on the next security group update. The purpose of
this change is to allow administrators to define
a list of chain names to protect, such that neutron
will not delete those chains or the rules within
them. The expectation is that these chains/rules
would then be managed by some other process. One
use case for this is managing a custom chain when
there is routed traffic to a host entering a compute
node not via an openstack router. Since this traffic
would ingress via an interface that neutron is not
aware of, iptables would not match it, and the
traffic would be accepted. Having a defined set of
protected iptables chains helps to mitigate this
potential security vulnerability.

Change-Id: I2addb7c9239e273d52e89c9bdd61e95354f813f5
'}, {'created': '2021-10-20 19:35:24.000000000', 'message': 'Allow definition of protected iptables chains

When an iptables rule is created on a compute node
not via neutron, if that rule references a chain
maintained by neutron, the rule will get deleted
on the next security group update. The purpose of
this change is to allow administrators to define
a list of chain names to protect, such that neutron
will not delete those chains or the rules within
them. The expectation is that these chains/rules
would then be managed by some other process. One
use case for this is managing a custom chain when
there is routed traffic to a host entering a compute
node not via an openstack router. Since this traffic
would ingress via an interface that neutron is not
aware of, iptables would not match it, and the
traffic would be accepted. Having a defined set of
protected iptables chains helps to mitigate this
potential security vulnerability.

The specific problem we are facing is that we have
routed traffic to a VM incoming via a Layer3 VXLAN
interface. When this traffic hits iptables, the
PHYSDEV-IN is the VXLAN interface, not the TAP
interface for the VM. Therefore, none of the
iptables rules created by neutron are matched, and
the traffic is accepted. Ideally, we want this
routed traffic to the VM to use the same iptables
chains as bridged traffic. Rather than duplicating
all of the rules, and changing PHYSDEV-IN to be the
VXLAN interface instead of the TAP interface, it
seems more efficient to simply redirect traffic to
the existing chains.

Since neutron uses an ACCEPT policy on all of the
FILTER chains, adding this feature serves to only
increase security.

Change-Id: I2addb7c9239e273d52e89c9bdd61e95354f813f5
'}, {'created': '2021-10-22 03:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Allow definition of protected iptables chains

node not via an openstack router. Since this traffic

protected iptables chains helps to mitigate this
potential security vulnerability.

routed traffic to a VM incoming via a Layer3 VXLAN
interface. When this traffic hits iptables, the
PHYSDEV-IN is the VXLAN interface, not the TAP
interface for the VM. Therefore, none of the
iptables rules created by neutron are matched, and
the traffic is accepted. Ideally, we want this
routed traffic to the VM to use the same iptables
chains as bridged traffic. Rather than duplicating
all of the rules, and changing PHYSDEV-IN to be the
VXLAN interface instead of the TAP interface, it
seems more efficient to simply redirect traffic to
the existing chains.

Since neutron uses an ACCEPT policy on all of the
FILTER chains, adding this feature serves to only
increase security.

Change-Id: I2addb7c9239e273d52e89c9bdd61e95354f813f5
'}]
commit_message:
Allow definition of protected iptables chains

When an iptables rule is created on a compute node
not via neutron, if that rule references a chain
maintained by neutron, the rule will get deleted
on the next security group update. The purpose of
this change is to allow administrators to define
a list of chain names to protect, such that neutron
will not delete those chains or the rules within
them. The expectation is that these chains/rules
would then be managed by some other process. One
use case for this is managing a custom chain when
there is routed traffic to a host entering a compute
node not via an openstack router. Since this traffic
would ingress via an interface that neutron is not
aware of, iptables would not match it, and the
traffic would be accepted. Having a defined set of
protected iptables chains helps to mitigate this
potential security vulnerability.

The specific problem we are facing is that we have
routed traffic to a VM incoming via a Layer3 VXLAN
interface. When this traffic hits iptables, the
PHYSDEV-IN is the VXLAN interface, not the TAP
interface for the VM. Therefore, none of the
iptables rules created by neutron are matched, and
the traffic is accepted. Ideally, we want this
routed traffic to the VM to use the same iptables
chains as bridged traffic. Rather than duplicating
all of the rules, and changing PHYSDEV-IN to be the
VXLAN interface instead of the TAP interface, it
seems more efficient to simply redirect traffic to
the existing chains.

Since neutron uses an ACCEPT policy on all of the
FILTER chains, adding this feature serves to only
increase security.

Change-Id: I2addb7c9239e273d52e89c9bdd61e95354f813f5

subject: Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"
messages: [{'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2021-10-22 03:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-10-22 11:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2021-10-22 14:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-10-22 14:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-22 03:20:49.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"

This reverts commit 2603a774b112dc6e25f9e7b2071124ea3d3d0012, which
converted cinder to use cluster configuration for stateless services.
While well-intentioned, this causes problems due to the lack of a
proper migration for those backends which are not able to support
ACTIVE-ACTIVE configuration.

Configurations that do not support ACTIVE_ACTIVE driver will have the
volume service fail to start, which will cause a service outage.

Change-Id: I7bf4baaf80e5bb58b5c1cf55a2065f3bc50dbced
Related-Bug: #1945239
(cherry picked from commit c5896a884a54d0171415d79a82a284e2ff6b2ca9)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"

This reverts commit 2603a774b112dc6e25f9e7b2071124ea3d3d0012, which
converted cinder to use cluster configuration for stateless services.
While well-intentioned, this causes problems due to the lack of a
proper migration for those backends which are not able to support
ACTIVE-ACTIVE configuration.

Configurations that do not support ACTIVE_ACTIVE driver will have the
volume service fail to start, which will cause a service outage.

Change-Id: I7bf4baaf80e5bb58b5c1cf55a2065f3bc50dbced
Related-Bug: #1945239
(cherry picked from commit c5896a884a54d0171415d79a82a284e2ff6b2ca9)

commit_message:
Sync default policy rules

This patch updates default policy-in-code rules in horizon based on
nova/neutron/keystone/glance RC deliverables. It doesn't update policy
rules for cinder as I have found no changes in cinder policy rules.

Change-Id: Ie249e6d066ad31c7783b936e52141b1745fd2703

messages:
[{'account_id': 27027, 'date': '2018-07-14 19:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-14 19:35:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-08-06 08:59:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

Hi Toni, welcome to DevStack and thanks for choosing to help to improve it. As you can see, we have a bit of a lack of reviewers, and you managed to submit your patch at the beginning of my holiday, so please excuse the lack of response so far.

The most important thing in order to proceed with this patch is to get the tests to pass, I added some comment regarding that below.

You may want to join the channel #openstack-qa on freenode for more direct communication, though that channel also isn't as busy as is used to be."}, {'account_id': 23913, 'date': '2018-09-12 13:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23913, 'date': '2018-09-12 13:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Renaming is_ubuntu to is_deb_based might not have been my best idea. devstack-plugin-mariadb now fails, because it uses is_ubuntu.'}, {'account_id': 23913, 'date': '2018-09-12 13:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-10-22 14:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We have a job working on Bullseye now. Feel free to reopen if you want to continue with this.'}]

commit_message:
Fix running devstack on Debian

* use a packages list specific for Debian

* rename is_ubuntu to is_deb_based and mark is_ubuntu as deprecated

* install build-essential instead of gcc and g++ for Debian

* make authentication succeed on MariaDB for Debian

Closes-Bug: #1673825
Change-Id: I74dc141c617ddfb0d79443be80560251cc20b709

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints job

This patch updates some packages version in lower-contraints.txt
to fix lower-constraint job. It also drops some linter from
lower-constraints.txt as not required for lower-constraints job.

Change-Id: If62522f716ae589d3b227ecdd1ea156090ca887a

commit_message:
Update requirements and release 2.2.0

+ remove ceilometer plugins since they require python-ceilometerclient
  that was deprecated long time ago and we cannot keep our requirements
  compatible with it anymore
+ update murano ctx to do not leave open file

Change-Id: Ic344ce0dcc791375438c20b2751da8ca3e24f242

commit_message:
add tuned to nova compute

Set profile "virtual-host" for nova-compute.
This profile enables transparent huge pages and
writes dirty pages back to disk more frequently,
and uses cpupower to set the performance cpufreq governor.
It will improve compute node performance.

Change-Id: I23d265c7a0768e5555c6ab514367fbfc32ec0c67

[{'created': '2018-09-03 04:27:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for s390x arch in kolla-ansible

s390x is a well known arch that used by enterprises

commit_message:
Add support for s390x arch in kolla-ansible

s390x is a well known arch that used by enterprises
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux_on_z_Systems on s390x

there are following hypervisors:
z/VM: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z/VM
KVM: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kernel-based_Virtual_Machine

both of them are now supported by nova:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/support-matrix.html

The patch set is going to enable kolla-ansible
on s390x arch for *KVM on s390x*.

Change-Id: I29ae5801957af0fd133d70ff0124cdacfbc065ce

commit_message:
Fix use of yaml.load()

The use of this function has been deprecated for a long time[0]. With
PyYAML==6.0 the call is now failing, so replace it with the safe
version.

[0] https://msg.pyyaml.org/load

Signed-off-by: Jens Harbott <frickler@offenerstapel.de>
Change-Id: I7a170262b50a5c80a516095b872d52e1bea5479d

Substring matching image's name

When querying the list of registered images, query according to some
characters of the iamge name.

Change-Id: I1c68efbe2583290bc41f7d35197ef108c484d607

commit_message:
Fix the help output for tripleo-mount-image

This change does the following to fix the help output of
tripleo-mount-image and tripleo-unmount-image
- defer set -x until actual inside the actual mount/unmount functions
- add --help to the getopt long arguments so it actually works
- print help and exit if mandatory arguments -a, -m are missing

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I6d16fd95c098559af9ec4e38b336819fc1663eef
(cherry picked from commit 6579b6858c827ebe5de5734682885182da024a9c)

[{'created': '2021-10-21 16:16:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove 'get_osc_show_columns_for_sdk_resource' duplicates

There were a number of 'get_osc_show_columns_for_sdk_resource' defined
in-tree. However, osc-lib has provided this method for some time (since
2.2.0, June 2020 [1] - our minimum version is currently 2.3.0) so
there's no need to provide our own copies. Remove them.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/osc-lib/commit/29a0c5a5

Change-Id: I25695f4f9a379dd691b7eaa1e3247164668ae77e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'get_osc_show_columns_for_sdk_resource' duplicates

There were a number of 'get_osc_show_columns_for_sdk_resource' defined
in-tree. However, osc-lib has provided this method for some time (since
2.2.0, June 2020 [1] - our minimum version is currently 2.3.0) so
there's no need to provide our own copies. Remove them.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/osc-lib/commit/29a0c5a5

Change-Id: I25695f4f9a379dd691b7eaa1e3247164668ae77e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a description of stopping ironic-api.service

According to the original document, before configuring ironic-api
behind mod_wsgi and restarting the httpd service, the ironic-api
service has been started. The port has been monitored by
ironic-api.service, and the error "Apache fails to start, Address
already in use" will be reported when the httpd service is restarted.

Add a description of stopping and disabling the ironic-api service
before starting httpd service.

task: 43713
Change-Id: Idc965d80d0fbaa348453a94ae45318157b2c0d0c

commit_message:
Ensure that we restart nfs-ganesha and manila share after config.

Recent changes to manila-ganesha broke how non-HA
deployments were configured, causing the manila-share
and nfs-ganesha processes to potentially start before
the config for them is correctly prepared. This
change ensures that these services are restarted once
their config is ready.

Change-Id: I4e63e64612554d74ffaca5c4e07b90f7ceb88d59

commit_message:
Fix context from_dict() for system_scope

A previous patch[1] added "system_scope" to the context for to_dict()
but the from_dict() method was not updated. This caused the
system_scope to always be None.
This patch corrects that by adding "system_scope" to the list of
values that may need to be extracted from the context dict.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.context/+/530509

Change-Id: Ica23d5c4183a692de3cb65a7ad72b19f47988ca6
(cherry picked from commit 8290621b058081754db55c2584c00b8b166369aa)
(cherry picked from commit 7187c672d41fc54a0368b766c0fa7a59677964d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-19 10:14:02.000000000', 'message': "db: Increase timeout for migration tests

We're seeing quite a few timeout failures on the following tests in
'nova.tests.unit.db.main.test_migrations':

- TestModelsLegacySyncMySQL.test_models_sync
- TestMigrationsWalkMySQL.test_walk_versions
- TestModelsSyncMySQL.test_innodb_tables
- TestModelsSyncMySQL.test_models_sync

Evidently MySQL is particularly affected here. Test run times are slow
even on a relatively powered machine like my localhost (Lenovo T460s w/
Intel Core i7-6600U CPU + 20G RAM) and the CI machines are only making
matters worse. Local experiments with alternative MySQL libraries, such
'mysqlclient', did not yield any improvements in performance so we must
simply live with this for now. Do so by setting 'TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR'
for these tests to 4, meaning these tests will now get a whopping 640
seconds (or over 10 minutes) to execute (we set OS_TEST_TIMEOUT to 160
in 'tox.ini'). We set this for both main and API DB migrations, even
though only the former is currently exhibiting issues, to head off
future problems. An alternative to this would be to override the timeout
on a test-by-test basis, as Cinder has done [1], but that seems more
complicated for no good reason. Yet another alternative would be to
reintroduce the serialization of these tests first introduced in change
I6ce930fa86c82da1008089791942b1fff7d04c18, but that is left until later
in the hopes that simply increasing the timeout will resolve the issues.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/19.0.0/cinder/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py

Change-Id: I82b9a064d77251945ff1ae99d7049f367ddde92e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Increase timeout for migration tests

We're seeing quite a few timeout failures on the following tests in
'nova.tests.unit.db.main.test_migrations':

- TestModelsLegacySyncMySQL.test_models_sync
- TestMigrationsWalkMySQL.test_walk_versions
- TestModelsSyncMySQL.test_innodb_tables
- TestModelsSyncMySQL.test_models_sync

Evidently MySQL is particularly affected here. Test run times are slow
even on a relatively powered machine like my localhost (Lenovo T460s w/
Intel Core i7-6600U CPU + 20G RAM) and the CI machines are only making
matters worse. Local experiments with alternative MySQL libraries, such
'mysqlclient', did not yield any improvements in performance so we must
simply live with this for now. Do so by setting 'TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR'
for these tests to 4, meaning these tests will now get a whopping 640
seconds (or over 10 minutes) to execute (we set OS_TEST_TIMEOUT to 160
in 'tox.ini'). We set this for both main and API DB migrations, even
though only the former is currently exhibiting issues, to head off
future problems. An alternative to this would be to override the timeout
on a test-by-test basis, as Cinder has done [1], but that seems more
complicated for no good reason. Yet another alternative would be to
reintroduce the serialization of these tests first introduced in change
I6ce930fa86c82da1008089791942b1fff7d04c18, but that is left until later
in the hopes that simply increasing the timeout will resolve the issues.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/19.0.0/cinder/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py

Change-Id: I82b9a064d77251945ff1ae99d7049f367ddde92e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 14:34:49.000000000', 'message': 'Move the daily periodic trigger earlier

The current time of 06:00 often clashes with the beginning of the
workday in Europe. Looking at current Grafana data, we seem to be having
a period of reduced load starting at around 00:00, so starting the
periodic jobs at 02:00 would hopefully allow us to better utilize our
resources.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id9ef2609b080040c68b42c07456ff92d73195304
'}]
commit_message:
Move the daily periodic trigger earlier

The current time of 06:00 often clashes with the beginning of the
workday in Europe. Looking at current Grafana data, we seem to be having
a period of reduced load starting at around 00:00, so starting the
periodic jobs at 02:00 would hopefully allow us to better utilize our
resources.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id9ef2609b080040c68b42c07456ff92d73195304

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for keystone-auth

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I4cf135dc9852506cc2e853c9faa8544b7b2e2fae

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for federated-monitoring

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I21ba5d8ca6f86954c793268142419e0a9e083943

commit_message:
Ensure that we restart nfs-ganesha and manila share after config.

Recent changes to manila-ganesha broke how non-HA
deployments were configured, causing the manila-share
and nfs-ganesha processes to potentially start before
the config for them is correctly prepared. This
change ensures that these services are restarted once
their config is ready.

Change-Id: I4e63e64612554d74ffaca5c4e07b90f7ceb88d59

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic65d88fa105a2345ce8dbc3973e634446ecbee4b

subject: Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"
messages: [{'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-10-22 01:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2021-10-22 03:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-22 01:55:53.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"

This reverts commit 2603a774b112dc6e25f9e7b2071124ea3d3d0012, which
converted cinder to use cluster configuration for stateless services.
While well-intentioned, this causes problems due to the lack of a
proper migration for those backends which are not able to support
ACTIVE-ACTIVE configuration.

Configurations that do not support ACTIVE_ACTIVE driver will have the
volume service fail to start, which will cause a service outage.

Change-Id: I7bf4baaf80e5bb58b5c1cf55a2065f3bc50dbced
Related-Bug: #1945239
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"

This reverts commit 2603a774b112dc6e25f9e7b2071124ea3d3d0012, which
converted cinder to use cluster configuration for stateless services.
While well-intentioned, this causes problems due to the lack of a
proper migration for those backends which are not able to support
ACTIVE-ACTIVE configuration.

Configurations that do not support ACTIVE_ACTIVE driver will have the
volume service fail to start, which will cause a service outage.

Change-Id: I7bf4baaf80e5bb58b5c1cf55a2065f3bc50dbced
Related-Bug: #1945239

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 19:25:53.000000000', 'message': 'add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

commit_message:
Remove the workaround to install repos on EL9

After merging patch [1] we are going to remove the
workaround to install the repos on EL9 in this patch.

Using this patch we get rid of centos9.repos in the nodepool [2].

[1]: https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/c/config/+/22954
[2]: https://logserver.rdoproject.org/50/36350/1/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-build-containers-centos-9-push-master/225929e/etc/yum.repos.d/

Change-Id: I0d63472894ac22ac5afd621974dd2885946d2464

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I25d070a183d6edfe0469332f5649c9b559d6aa88

'}]
commit_message:
Flatten yaql list expressions

In python yaql 2, the expressions are returning a nested list but we
need a list of dictionaries in order to use map_merge.  This change adds
flatten so it returns [] instead of [[]] when nothing is available.

Change-Id: Iba0262fbc2af0903f02c8c28c7ba2b1d935abe7f
(cherry picked from commit 20311a0a50af684f2eab1a98adb58fe94f5ce933)

[{'created': '2021-10-13 16:26:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove helm status from deployment scripts for multinode

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: Ia600b979bf48629962577b3c5674bfa7415d78c0

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for multinode

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: Ia600b979bf48629962577b3c5674bfa7415d78c0

commit_message:
Revert update constraint for selenium to new release 4.0.0

This patch partially revert Id1e12179980ad4eb64b8de6fcc1280698bbb2661.
horizon selenium-headless and integration-tests job start failing
after updating selenium version 3.141.0 -> 4.0.0. So let's use
selenium older version until we fixed the failed gate job with new
selenium version.

Related bug: 1947847

Change-Id: I461ab4189fb652c78bc11d0a9283d98948c2725c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-27 13:47:19.000000000', 'message': '[Stable only] remove require_exclusive_lock from detect_vendor

Presumably it was added by a mistake in the Ussuri backport.
Functions that only read data from the BMC must not require
an exclusive lock, and this bug causes a failure when syncing power
state.

Change-Id: I051da583ef6e5131ce36b70b862e91cfdae2b213
(cherry picked from commit e9b16d026171436c66d1651e38c71c9f20acb144)
'}]
commit_message:
[Stable only] remove require_exclusive_lock from detect_vendor

Presumably it was added by a mistake in the Ussuri backport.
Functions that only read data from the BMC must not require
an exclusive lock, and this bug causes a failure when syncing power
state.

Change-Id: I051da583ef6e5131ce36b70b862e91cfdae2b213
(cherry picked from commit e9b16d026171436c66d1651e38c71c9f20acb144)

[{'created': '2021-10-18 22:02:35.000000000', 'message': 'bnr fix the exportation of the ceph authentication

The file ceph authetication is not being generated due to an
undefined variable.

This patch inserts the tasks that saves the content of
the file in to the block, so the variables are defined.

Change-Id: Id0c841723da00096e379133429a685bffaf407d3
(cherry picked from commit 442c0bc3ac0133b8ef82da2d86d33734692fb49a)

commit_message:
bnr fix the exportation of the ceph authentication

The file ceph authetication is not being generated due to an
undefined variable.

This patch inserts the tasks that saves the content of
the file in to the block, so the variables are defined.

Change-Id: Id0c841723da00096e379133429a685bffaf407d3
(cherry picked from commit 442c0bc3ac0133b8ef82da2d86d33734692fb49a)

subject: Inspection - console to tty0 and ttyS0
messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-10-20 16:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-10-21 06:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-21 18:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 16:05:58.000000000', 'message': "Inspection - console to tty0 and ttyS0

In tripleo-common iamge-yaml's we set:
  'console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200'
So that console is on to both the serial and virtual terminal.

Let's use the same default for inspection on the undercloud by
setting IronicInspectorKernelArgs accordingly.

Change-Id: Iae0c0a0346f353def8a7bf349f192472b2d8437b
"}]
commit_message:
Inspection - console to tty0 and ttyS0

In tripleo-common iamge-yaml's we set:
  'console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200'
So that console is on to both the serial and virtual terminal.

Let's use the same default for inspection on the undercloud by
setting IronicInspectorKernelArgs accordingly.

Change-Id: Iae0c0a0346f353def8a7bf349f192472b2d8437b

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-10-21 14:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2021-10-21 14:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-10-21 16:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-21 14:51:41.000000000', 'message': "Make sure resource_op_defaults are set before bundles

See LP#1948032. We set a higher default resource op time out because
podman often times out within the default 20s. We need to guarantee
that this timeout is set *before* we create any bundles otherwise
it might be too late and we'd fail a deployment like described in the
LP.

Change-Id: Ic6ac8d21d12389e70cd382018290324d3ae948ce
Closes-Bug: #1948032
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure resource_op_defaults are set before bundles

See LP#1948032. We set a higher default resource op time out because
podman often times out within the default 20s. We need to guarantee
that this timeout is set *before* we create any bundles otherwise
it might be too late and we'd fail a deployment like described in the
LP.

Change-Id: Ic6ac8d21d12389e70cd382018290324d3ae948ce
Closes-Bug: #1948032

commit_message:
21.10 - Stable cut of charms for release

* On stable/21.10 branch
* Point charms to stable libraries
* Update bundles to point to stable charms
* Pin cffi

Change-Id: Iaeaf8974bd752e286e42266549912cbe2be318d2
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Pre-release cleanup of 21.10 release notes

Ready to release 21.10.

Trying out an auto-generated TOC. It is painful and
error-prone to construct it manually over the course
of the cycle. The section headers are now links that
point back to the top of the page. These links can
be disabled.

Change-Id: I2c04d6548cca7b6f0647f2ee203b5a243ba13136

- Use recordset update / delete instead of just record delete.

Closes-Bug: #1947765
Change-Id: I867600eb48a3e30a4d17471ab794ca717706823d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in the sink when deleting records

Updated the sink to behave closer to how we handle this type
of operations in designate.api.v2.

- Added object validation to all requests.
- Better test coverage.
- Use recordset update / delete instead of just record delete.

Closes-Bug: #1947765
Change-Id: I867600eb48a3e30a4d17471ab794ca717706823d

subject: Ensure the nova service user is a system-admin
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-26 13:57:18.000000000', 'message': "Ensure the nova service user is a system-admin

Neutron calls some system-specific nova APIs/policies
(os_compute_api:os-server-external-events:create). When nova is
configured to enforce scope, these calls fail because the nova service
doesn't have the admin role on the system.

We are expecting to hit more cases like this as more services adopt
system scope. This commit uses a common function to grant the nova
service user the admin role on the system after it's created.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/805452
Change-Id: I000209a4677d7db5622016667ea7d38626d50918
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure the nova service user is a system-admin

Neutron calls some system-specific nova APIs/policies
(os_compute_api:os-server-external-events:create). When nova is
configured to enforce scope, these calls fail because the nova service
doesn't have the admin role on the system.

We are expecting to hit more cases like this as more services adopt
system scope. This commit uses a common function to grant the nova
service user the admin role on the system after it's created.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/805452
Change-Id: I000209a4677d7db5622016667ea7d38626d50918

subject: Add a common function for system role assignments
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-26 13:57:18.000000000', 'message': "Add a common function for system role assignments

As more and more services adopt system scope across OpenStack we're
going to need a function to grant system role assignments to users,
including service users.

This commit introduces a new function that creates system role
assignments in keystone and it's similar to the existing functions we
have for creating project role assignments.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/805452
Change-Id: Ie26b5770304bc43b9bde36efe1eda29a520fc287
"}]
commit_message:
Add a common function for system role assignments

As more and more services adopt system scope across OpenStack we're
going to need a function to grant system role assignments to users,
including service users.

This commit introduces a new function that creates system role
assignments in keystone and it's similar to the existing functions we
have for creating project role assignments.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/805452
Change-Id: Ie26b5770304bc43b9bde36efe1eda29a520fc287

[{'created': '2021-08-20 19:55:42.000000000', 'message': "Add test coverages for system-admins creating instances

This commit adds a straight-forward test that we can use to test all the
necessary integration bits we'll need to actually adopt system-scope.

This change is likely going to depend on a slew of other changes before
it will pass. For example, keystonemiddleware will need to pull project
IDs off of system-scoped requests. Tempest clients will need to expose a
way to pass project IDs in requests for system clients. Keystoneauth
will need to handle context objects with both system and project
attributes and craft requests appropriately so services like nova can
pass project IDs along to other services like neutron.

This test is the basis for flushing out all those other changes we still
need.

commit_message:
Add test coverage for system-admins creating instances

This commit adds a straight-forward test that we can use to test all the
necessary integration bits we'll need to actually adopt system-scope.

This change is likely going to depend on a slew of other changes before
it will pass. For example, keystonemiddleware will need to pull project
IDs off of system-scoped requests. Tempest clients will need to expose a
way to pass project IDs in requests for system clients. Keystoneauth
will need to handle context objects with both system and project
attributes and craft requests appropriately so services like nova can
pass project IDs along to other services like neutron.

This test is the basis for flushing out all those other changes we still
need.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/805456
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystonemiddleware/+/787822
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/806187

Change-Id: Iec7e473be5864c29c2747513622f400bcaef350d

commit_message:
Remove deleting Kibana indices before pod start up

Deleting kibana indices in the start script will result in
kibana index patterns to be removed at each pod restart.
This patchset corrects that issue.

This patchset also removes the annotation for helm hooks.
It is not needed as there is dependency set already in
values.yaml for the register_kibana_indexes job.

Note that these changes are reverting some of the changes
introduced by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/805246.
The kibana image has also been reverted and therefore the above 2 changes are not
necessary.

Change-Id: Icc6a74e2e23b1e663d989943bc5f3d457e167376

commit_message:
Remove Kibana indices before pod start up

The ps removes kibana indices from elasticsearch when a pod
comes up. It also removes the source code in values.yaml for
the flush job since it is not needed at this point.

Change-Id: Icb0376fed4872308b26e608d5be0fbac504d802d

subject: py3: proxy: Fake sources should always use byte-string bodies

hah, when you find the error before you see the bug report 😄

so we can definately create a test for this:

Jan 31 13:00:19.411485 hostname swift [7863]: ERROR Unhandled exception in request: #012Traceback (most recent call last):#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/proxy/server.py", line 680, in handle_request#012 resp = handler(req)#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/proxy/controllers/base.py", line 2122, in HEAD#012 return self.GETorHEAD(req)#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/proxy/controllers/account.py", line 74, in GETorHEAD#012 req.swift_entity_path.rstrip('/'), concurrency)#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/proxy/controllers/base.py", line 2186, in GETorHEAD_base#012 headers=handler.source_headers)#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/proxy/controllers/base.py", line 2053, in best_response#012 quorum_size=quorum_size)#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/proxy/controllers/base.py", line 2096, in _compute_quorum_response#012 resp.body = bodies[status_index]#012 File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/swift/common/swob.py", line 387, in setter#012 raise TypeError('WSGI responses must be bytes')#012TypeError: WSGI responses must be bytes (txn: txffb2b8b13a2f4cc1a27ad-006016a9d8)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-09-27 20:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(3 comments)'}]

commit_message:
21.10 - Stable cut of charms for release

* On stable/21.10 branch
* Point charms to stable libraries
* Update bundles to point to stable charms
* Pin cffi

Change-Id: I4e01cbd9a20f12a100983c522d8bae748d848281
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

The key parameter of swift backend is used to define a credentail to

In Glance the user parameter(swift_store_user) is also defined as

commit_message:
Swift backend: the key parameter should be secret

The key parameter of swift backend is used to define a credentail to
access Swift so should be hidden in logs.

In Glance the user parameter(swift_store_user) is also defined as
a secret parameter. However it defines user name or id and user name
or id is not currently treated as secret in puppet, so this change
doesn't cover the user parameter.

Change-Id: Iac580df4de14ffdb19436417b2830a834efd087d

commit_message:
Modify key repo file permissions

keystone currently emits a warning on world-readable fernet keys
on every single key transaction. This fills the logs with a lot
of warnings. This change is an attempt to fix the file permission
issue.

Change-Id: Ic71fd50d798da9bf7c338d17f3016d6c3b671d83

commit_message:
Ensure KLB is updated

We're moving this because we discovered that Octavia will not always
raise Conflict if you create an LB with the same IP.

If no VIP port got created for an LB, then Octavia will not have any
issue with creating another LB with the same IP.

Closes-Bug: 1947809

Change-Id: I26b911b30403c7ea5a35706b2fc80af499e91330

commit_message:
Fix gates

Remove python-ceilometerclient for heat added as work-around until
[0] is merged. Python-ceilometerclient is deprecated and incompatible
with current master requirements.

Also Disable watcher build for master due to dependency on
python-ceilometerclient.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/heat/+/813724

Change-Id: Id25baad68a94911efda547f166efc9a0516ced65
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] "ControllerAgent" should accept Chassis and Chassis_Private

Because we support OVN version with and without Chassis_Private,
"ControllerAgent" should accept both type of registers. In Chassis, the
"external_ids" are stored as a main attribute while in Chassis_Private
are stored on the chassis reference list.

Closes-bug: #1933401

Change-Id: I4575ca06ccba3537a8fd2347b837231e0643e64c
(cherry picked from commit 1f3762b0fb8258e2f77b600df8ab96f20d65f5b8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 20:08:06.000000000', 'message': 'Do not ask for cephdashboard certificates when it is disabled

When deploying with TLS-E and cephadm, I disabled the ceph dashboard:
(undercloud) [stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ openstack stack environment show
overcloud -f yaml |grep -i cephenabledashboard

  CephEnableDashboard: false

Yet it still tries to request a cert for it (and fails due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1926746):
2021-05-03 14:02:54.876228 | 5254004b-fe7a-614d-c9eb-00000000e323 |
FATAL | Ensure certificate requests | ctrl-3-0 | item={'ca': 'ipa',
'dns': 'ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw', 'key_size': '2048', 'name':
'ceph_dashboard', 'principal':
'ceph_dashboard/ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw@BGP.FTW', 'run_after': '#
Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk \'/ceph-mgr/
{print $1}\')\n# Restart the mgr systemd unit\nif [ -n "$mgr_unit" ];
then\n systemctl restart "$mgr_unit"\nfi\n'} |
error={"ansible_loop_var": "item", "changed": false, "cmd":
"/bin/getcert request -N CN=ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw -c IPA -w -k
/etc/pki/tls/private/ceph_dashboard.key -f
/etc/pki/tls/certs/ceph_dashboard.crt -D ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw -D
'' -A '' -E '' -r -g 2048 -K '' -K '' -u digitalSignature -u
keyEncipherment -U 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1 -U 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.2 -U '' -B '' -C
/etc/certmonger/post-scripts/ceph_dashboard-838da8a.sh", "item": {"ca":
"ipa", "dns": "ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw", "key_size": "2048",
"name": "ceph_dashboard", "principal":
"ceph_dashboard/ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw@BGP.FTW", "run_after": "#
Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk '/ceph-mgr/
{print $1}')\n# Restart the mgr systemd unit\nif [ -n \"$mgr_unit\" ];
then\n systemctl restart \"$mgr_unit\"\nfi\n"}, "msg": "", "rc": 2,
"stderr": "", "stderr_lines": [], "stdout": "New signing request
\"20210503140253\" added.\n", "stdout_lines": ["New signing request
\"20210503140253\" added."]}

With this patch applied I correctly get passed this point and am able to
reach later steps:
2021-05-04 12:40:44.300445 | 5254004b-fe7a-5ccf-c0b9-0000000000df | TASK | External deployment step 2

The problem is that the 'enable_internal_tls' is global and only checks
for internal TLS being enabled so it will still be triggered when
CephEnabledDashboard is set to false. Let's switch it to the internal
condition internal_tls_enabled which takes the dashboard into account.

Change-Id: I73a58b00f31bfeffb724e12515d8c5cb0625ca7f
Closes-Bug: #1927093
(cherry picked from commit 92f722a05c361333ec3e3712e3f8ae7569abda49)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not ask for cephdashboard certificates when it is disabled

When deploying with TLS-E and cephadm, I disabled the ceph dashboard:
(undercloud) [stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ openstack stack environment show
overcloud -f yaml |grep -i cephenabledashboard

  CephEnableDashboard: false

Yet it still tries to request a cert for it (and fails due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1926746):
2021-05-03 14:02:54.876228 | 5254004b-fe7a-614d-c9eb-00000000e323 |
FATAL | Ensure certificate requests | ctrl-3-0 | item={'ca': 'ipa',
'dns': 'ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw', 'key_size': '2048', 'name':
'ceph_dashboard', 'principal':
'ceph_dashboard/ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw@BGP.FTW', 'run_after': '#
Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk \'/ceph-mgr/
{print $1}\')\n# Restart the mgr systemd unit\nif [ -n "$mgr_unit" ];
then\n systemctl restart "$mgr_unit"\nfi\n'} |
error={"ansible_loop_var": "item", "changed": false, "cmd":
"/bin/getcert request -N CN=ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw -c IPA -w -k
/etc/pki/tls/private/ceph_dashboard.key -f
/etc/pki/tls/certs/ceph_dashboard.crt -D ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw -D
'' -A '' -E '' -r -g 2048 -K '' -K '' -u digitalSignature -u
keyEncipherment -U 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1 -U 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.2 -U '' -B '' -C
/etc/certmonger/post-scripts/ceph_dashboard-838da8a.sh", "item": {"ca":
"ipa", "dns": "ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw", "key_size": "2048",
"name": "ceph_dashboard", "principal":
"ceph_dashboard/ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw@BGP.FTW", "run_after": "#
Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk '/ceph-mgr/
{print $1}')\n# Restart the mgr systemd unit\nif [ -n \"$mgr_unit\" ];
then\n systemctl restart \"$mgr_unit\"\nfi\n"}, "msg": "", "rc": 2,
"stderr": "", "stderr_lines": [], "stdout": "New signing request
\"20210503140253\" added.\n", "stdout_lines": ["New signing request
\"20210503140253\" added."]}

With this patch applied I correctly get passed this point and am able to
reach later steps:
2021-05-04 12:40:44.300445 | 5254004b-fe7a-5ccf-c0b9-0000000000df | TASK | External deployment step 2

The problem is that the 'enable_internal_tls' is global and only checks
for internal TLS being enabled so it will still be triggered when
CephEnabledDashboard is set to false. Let's switch it to the internal
condition internal_tls_enabled which takes the dashboard into account.

Change-Id: I73a58b00f31bfeffb724e12515d8c5cb0625ca7f
Closes-Bug: #1927093
(cherry picked from commit 92f722a05c361333ec3e3712e3f8ae7569abda49)

commit_message:
Add support for openvswitch interface driver with OVN

This patch enables the openvswitch interface driver when the
ML2/OVN driver is used. An interface driver is required when
using the legacy DHCP agent (required for OVN+Ironic).

Change-Id: I56bad4e6ec94b516d1e94d76b423cc3437e3f464

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

[{'created': '2021-10-21 12:12:33.000000000', 'message': 'Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)
'}]
commit_message:
Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-16 01:28:50.000000000', 'message': "React on 404 when creating LB resources

If Kuryr attempts to create an Octavia resource for a loadbalancer that
is no more, we'll get 404 from Octavia API and do nothing more. This
commit changes the behavior to release the LB and clean the state in
such case, effectively triggering a recreation of the LB.

Change-Id: I1b90cc63bda5d899ed85dbe50387bf8dc0c272cd
"}]
commit_message:
React on 404 when creating LB resources

If Kuryr attempts to create an Octavia resource for a loadbalancer that
is no more, we'll get 404 from Octavia API and do nothing more. This
commit changes the behavior to release the LB and clean the state in
such case, effectively triggering a recreation of the LB.

Change-Id: I1b90cc63bda5d899ed85dbe50387bf8dc0c272cd

commit_message:
dont block kuryr if one subnet runs out of IPs

IpAddressGenerationFailureClient causes VIF Handler to fail, that causes
restart. In large environments this restart can take significant amount
of time causing other projects to slow down the process of creating new
pods.

This failure is not Kuryr failure and Kuryr can still function
successfuly without it.

Closes-Bug: 1943644
Change-Id: I35d5be9ac48c7041be8127ca31d09cf33279e3d7

[{'created': '2021-07-08 10:04:34.000000000', 'message': "Support Ansible diff mode

Adds a '--diff' argument to kayobe CLI commands. This is passed through
to ansible-playbook for Kayobe Ansible playbooks, and can be used with
the '--check' argument to see changes that would be made to files.

This change also passes through --check and --diff arguments to
kolla-ansible.

Task: 42794

Adds a '--diff' argument to kayobe CLI commands. This is passed through
to ansible-playbook for Kayobe Ansible playbooks, and can be used with
the '--check' argument to see changes that would be made to files.

This change also passes through --check and --diff arguments to
kolla-ansible.

Story: 2009038
Task: 42794

Change-Id: I350795c328c0dc0a91a5cd500c252c5b7b1eafc1
"}]
commit_message:
Support Ansible diff mode

Adds a '--diff' argument to kayobe CLI commands. This is passed through
to ansible-playbook for Kayobe Ansible playbooks, and can be used with
the '--check' argument to see changes that would be made to files.

This change also passes through --check and --diff arguments to
kolla-ansible.

Story: 2009038
Task: 42794

Change-Id: I350795c328c0dc0a91a5cd500c252c5b7b1eafc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 09:00:20.000000000', 'message': 'add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)
'}]
commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

subject: Add hyphenated commands
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-18 11:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2021-06-18 14:03:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-06-18 17:37:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So I have two comments.

After years of work to move everything under a unified client, removing all the hyphens, we want to put them all back?

  old: neutron floatingip-create
  new: openstack floating ip create
  newer: openstack floating-ip-create

Personally I like the current syntax: openstack <object> <operation> <arguments>
Switching this could create confusion, and will keep the doc writers busy :)
Just my opinion. I could live with both but don't think we should deprecate the current syntax.

What about things that aren't in-tree?  For example, like the Octavia client operations?"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-01 15:36:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Updating to -1 since after thinking about it I don't think this is a good idea."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-07-01 15:44:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think this is a good idea. We put a lot of work into moving away from the monolithic commands of the old clients.

Specifically, this adds yet more confusion by having multiple commands for the same thing, some client plugins will probably lag the change, and all of the documentation referencing the CLI will need to be re-written again. Not to mention the stackoverflow articles that would be different.

As a user, you have the option of creating these aliases locally for your use.
Why can't you just add them to a local aliases list?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-21 16:22:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Yeah, as much as this design pains me, it's not really worth inflicting real pain on users. Oh well"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-18 11:16:50.000000000', 'message': "Add hyphenated commands

Instead of using e.g. 'openstack server add floating ip', start using
'openstack server add-floating-ip'. This is easier to autocomplete and
avoids conflicts where part of the command name conflicts with an
arbitrary argument. Old aliases are preserved but can be removed in the
future. This is likely to be contentious but it resolves a years-long
bugbear of mine and in theory should make the UI far more pleasant to
use over the long-term.

Change-Id: Ifda58214ac442112bf1801ab2f15496d3be96fcb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add hyphenated commands

Instead of using e.g. 'openstack server add floating ip', start using
'openstack server add-floating-ip'. This is easier to autocomplete and
avoids conflicts where part of the command name conflicts with an
arbitrary argument. Old aliases are preserved but can be removed in the
future. This is likely to be contentious but it resolves a years-long
bugbear of mine and in theory should make the UI far more pleasant to
use over the long-term.

Change-Id: Ifda58214ac442112bf1801ab2f15496d3be96fcb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-21 13:16:16.000000000', 'message': "Drop '--infra-rename' argument

There is a plan to move to source only images. So infra images stuff
would not be needed == this switch is worthless.

Change-Id: I50ec5dd7e97028a15758c46eee8c45d8052d0363
"}]
commit_message:
Drop '--infra-rename' argument

There is a plan to move to source only images. So infra images stuff
would not be needed == this switch is worthless.

Change-Id: I50ec5dd7e97028a15758c46eee8c45d8052d0363

commit_message:
Add note about Grafana certificate

Some environments may experience failure as Grafana graphs
will silently fail to display due to an unverified TLS
certificate for the Grafana server. Add a note about this
and how to overcome it.

Change-Id: I29ec8d63a50b31268129f7717f4931fc75d53d59

* doc/source/configuration/reference/ansible.rst'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-30 08:50:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-30 14:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-10-01 08:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Set Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-10-01 08:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-10-01 14:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-10-20 15:13:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-10-21 07:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 07:46:41.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
(cherry picked from commit 2648f48746fa01a5215e1fd9c79a0e7821414841)

commit_message:
Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
(cherry picked from commit 2648f48746fa01a5215e1fd9c79a0e7821414841)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 16:20:39.000000000', 'message': "Remove helm status from deployment scripts for elastic-beats

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I5c6dc5ea826c57b8c442ee0e876010a9ab726612
"}]
commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for elastic-beats

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I5c6dc5ea826c57b8c442ee0e876010a9ab726612

commit_message:
Add CloudSIG xena release file

Add release file for Testing CloudSIG xena repo [1].
This will be used to run some scenario jobs in RDO[2] which
will build containers using CloudSIG repo and then deploy
those containers.

current-tripleo-rdo is used instead of current-tripleo
as TripleO has not branched stable/xena and not running
promotion pipeline for xena[3].

[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/cloud/x86_64/openstack-xena/
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdoinfo/+/36340
[3] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/xena/tripleo-independent-release.html

Change-Id: Ib393188b68cf923231cba81a62d05011fe0387ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-20 11:36:23.000000000', 'message': 'Drop legacy undercloud install

Use undercloud_install from tripleo-operator-ansible
for all supported releases i.e train+.

Also cleanup vars/templates related to legacy undercloud
install.

Due to release=master condition tripleo-operator-ansible
was used only for master and in mean while there were
multiple releases.

Change-Id: I813decf17ff58b53677bd84a4fab5c1fad7d60ef
'}]
commit_message:
Drop legacy undercloud install

Use undercloud_install from tripleo-operator-ansible
for all supported releases i.e train+.

Also cleanup vars/templates related to legacy undercloud
install.

Due to release=master condition tripleo-operator-ansible
was used only for master and in mean while there were
multiple releases.

Change-Id: I813decf17ff58b53677bd84a4fab5c1fad7d60ef

subject: Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab
messages: [{'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-10-21 12:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-10-21 12:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-21 12:11:29.000000000', 'message': 'Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)
'}]
commit_message:
Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)

subject: Rules in policy directory files can be deleted.
messages:
[{'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-09-14 13:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-09-14 13:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2021-09-15 06:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-09-15 07:16:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

The main idea of patch is if rules in policy.d folder were changed then we reset rules and re-calculate all rules in main policy file and apply rules from policy.d folder on top of rules in main policy folder.
We need to solve problem:
1. initial state
main_policies = {"rule_1": "a"}
policy_d_folder = {"rule_1": "b"}
result_policy = main_policy
result_policy.update(policy_d_folder)
result_policy equals {"rule_1": "b"}

2.empty policy.d folder
policy_d_folder = {}
rules calculation: result_policy.update(policy_d_folder)
result_policy equals {"rule_1": "b"}

This behavior is wrong.
So we changed logic in step 2
If policy_d_folder changed then we reset rules and calculate all rules from scratch.
result_policy = main_policy
result_policy.update(policy_d_folder)'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-09-15 07:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-09-15 07:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-14 13:41:32.000000000', 'message': 'Policy directory files cannot reset rules.

Policy directory rules only can add new rules or
update existing rules in cache, but cannot reset rules
that were set in previous file editions.

Also Member "_loaded_files" of class Enforcer should keep
list of loaded policy config files pathes.
In fact if the same file is changed many times
then the same file path is added many times.
If a file is deleted it's path not deleted from "_loaded_files".
The member is very misleading and is not used in code.
So this member was deleted in code.

Change-Id: I9ede38d8cf2ae968d3d8c0b1240bd6a51e6aa931

commit_message:
Rules in policy directory files can be deleted.

Policy directory files can only add new rules or
update existing rules in cache, but cannot return back
loaded rules in memory to their default value.
This incorrect behavior was fixed in the patch.

Member "_loaded_files" of class Enforcer should keep
list of loaded policy config files paths.
In fact if the same file is changed many times
then the same file path is added many times.
If a file is deleted it's path not deleted from "_loaded_files".
The member is very misleading and is not used in code.
So this member was deleted in the patch because of
above mentioned resons.

Change-Id: I9ede38d8cf2ae968d3d8c0b1240bd6a51e6aa931
Closes-Bug: 1943584

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:50:42.000000000', 'message': 'CI: run host configure DNF tests on CentOS Stream

skipping DNF checks on CentOS Stream.

commit_message:
Prevent Bifrost from using firewalld

This is to avoid conflicting with iptables rules configured on the seed
host by Kayobe.

A new variable kolla_bifrost_use_firewalld is introduced to configure
whether Bifrost uses firewalld.

Change-Id: I7049eae6518f818f9e180dfdb6f515d527644808
Story: 2009252
Task: 43442
(cherry picked from commit 9f6c912b3418b21c06f53860e786b5b56daddff6)

commit_message:
Prevent Bifrost from using firewalld

This is to avoid conflicting with iptables rules configured on the seed
host by Kayobe.

A new variable kolla_bifrost_use_firewalld is introduced to configure
whether Bifrost uses firewalld.

Change-Id: I7049eae6518f818f9e180dfdb6f515d527644808
Story: 2009252
Task: 43442
(cherry picked from commit 9f6c912b3418b21c06f53860e786b5b56daddff6)

commit_message:
Fix molecule job

This adds the possibility to sova uses a local file instead of
downloading from github.
This is required because the verification searchs for a specific
failure, that recently was updated in the sova config file, and
the test started to fail. So, now, we use a static sova config
file to be used by the molecule, avoiding these kind of failures
happen in the future.

Change-Id: I2530188f1795a39ec6ec7e43c9ba118349c08541

commit_message:
Add el9 vars file for bootstrap

We need to create a el9 bootstrap file to ensure the packages get
installed correctly. Currently it's falling back to redhat.yml which is
really the el7 file.

Change-Id: I070c9a7703655f642894f9f6885256806db54d3c

commit_message:
Removing validations.yml playbook from job definition

The validations.yml playbook is going to be included
in the multinode.yml.
Executing it twice is not necessary and could lead to
suboptimal results.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/814407

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5dd904a66de07b77892966c0a375084e2401fb0c

[{'created': '2021-10-19 21:53:46.000000000', 'message': "Break apart clouds.yaml creation

Instead of waiting untill all users are created to lay down the
clouds.yaml file, let's populate it with the admin profiles first so
that we have something we can use to create other resources in keystone
immediately.

This helps remove the usage of environment variables for authorization.

Change-Id: I0aadaa3b75123bc14b9105bad3fa7e7934d6b853
"}]
commit_message:
Break apart clouds.yaml creation

Instead of waiting untill all users are created to lay down the
clouds.yaml file, let's populate it with the admin profiles first so
that we have something we can use to create other resources in keystone
immediately.

This helps remove the usage of environment variables for authorization.

Change-Id: I0aadaa3b75123bc14b9105bad3fa7e7934d6b853

commit_message:
Set proxy option in early dnf invocation

If hosts need to use a proxy to install packages and python is absent,
the call to install the python package will hang, at least on CentOS.

Set proxy if it exists in dnf_config using a command-line option. Later
uses of dnf will be after dnf.conf has been updated.

Change-Id: Ic949577afd3ea07306cebf224637a08a1ecce0f5
Story: 2009274
Task: 43528
(cherry picked from commit 29d73eed7a175f8d4126570c3321dc966f0547f1)

commit_message:
Use 'cluster' config only for Active/Active drivers.

Cinder allows the use of the 'cluster' configuration key only when the
driver(s) configured claim to support 'Active/Active HA'.

This patch reads the key 'active_active_ha' from the related
subordinates to determine if the configured storage can be clustered.

Closes-Bug: #1947702
Change-Id: I84476fe1c1457a432ede531de9847787366b7bb0

commit_message:
Install systemd-container on hosts

Systemd-container package is required for a properly
orchestrated restart of nova_libvirt container (at the least).
It complements Iefe861f91cefe2a9cf773cae98b2440566ae8b5e

Closes-bug: #1945791
Related: rhbz#2010135

Change-Id: Ida8a6fadc8873f564e21b21e2bb34cc93a4c50d4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make sure that rabbitmq_cacert has 'undef' as a default.

This is done so that the deployment does not fail if we do not pass any
rabbitmq:ssl_cacert key at all. This is needed on SSL (non TLS-E)
undercloud installations, see LP and related tht patch.

Change-Id: I4e9801ba3ced734e5aa3fa22df522fab0e84761a
Related-Bug: #1947776
(cherry picked from commit a9e0ec90f493880a8783b1654c82a4578df2a458)

[{'created': '2021-07-13 10:57:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove deprecation of heartbeat_in_pthread

In some circumstances services can be executed outside of mod_wsgi and
in a monkey patched environment. In this context we need to leave the
possibility to users to execute the heartbeat in a green thread.

The heartbeat_in_pthread was tagged as depreacted few months and planned
for a future removal. These changes drop this deprecation to allow to

The heartbeat_in_pthread was tagged as depreacted few months and planned
for a future removal. These changes drop this deprecation to allow to

Closes-Bug: #1934937
Change-Id: Iee2e5a6f7d71acba70bbc857f0bd7d83e32a7b8c

commit_message:
Remove deprecation of heartbeat_in_pthread

In some circumstances services can be executed outside of mod_wsgi and
in a monkey patched environment. In this context we need to leave the
possibility to users to execute the heartbeat in a green thread.

The heartbeat_in_pthread was tagged as depreacted few months and planned
for a future removal. These changes drop this deprecation to allow to
enable green threads if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1934937
Change-Id: Iee2e5a6f7d71acba70bbc857f0bd7d83e32a7b8c

commit_message:
Replace py35 zuul/osci with charm yoga jobs

Python3.5 will not be supported by the 22.01 release of the
OpenStack charms.
